intro: Menkea australis, commonly known as the Australian menkea, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slight aromatic scent. Menkea australis is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
